Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant that has lived and grown with water and light.
The student can draw an unhealthy plant that has not lived and grown due to a lack of water.
The student can draw an unhealthy plant that has not lived and grown due to a lack of light.
The student can label each drawing to show whether it had water and light or not, although labels may occasionally lack detail or consistency.
The student can illustrate a pattern by showing what happens to plants with different amounts of water and light, though some variations might lack precision.
CANNOT: The student may sometimes omit or mislabel parts of the drawing where they illustrate differing water quantities (e.g., drawing plants with varying water levels inconsistently).

The student might occasionally confuse the specific effects of lack of water or light on the plant's appearance, showing some overlap in symptoms (e.g., drooping leaves for both, whereas lack of light might stifle growth, and lack of water leads to wilting).
